title: The Four Cardinal Virtues
content: The four cardinal virtues are prudence, justice, fortitude, and temperance. They are called 'cardinal' because all other moral virtues are grouped around them. Prudence guides practical reason to discern the true good. Justice gives each person their due. Fortitude ensures firmness in difficulties. Temperance moderates the attraction of pleasures.

title: The Theological Virtues
content: The three theological virtues are faith, hope, and charity (love). They are called 'theological' because they relate directly to God. Faith enables us to believe in God. Hope enables us to desire heaven and eternal life. Charity enables us to love God above all things and our neighbor as ourselves for the love of God.

title: The Seven Sacraments
content: The seven sacraments are Baptism, Confirmation, Eucharist, Penance (Reconciliation), Anointing of the Sick, Holy Orders, and Matrimony. They are efficacious signs of grace instituted by Christ and entrusted to the Church, by which divine life is dispensed to us.
